Page 1 of 24

SOLAR INSTALLATION CONTRACT

This Commercial Solar Installation Contract (this “Contract”) is made and entered into on the date set forth below, by and between Lumina Solar, Inc., a Maryland corporation (“Lumina”) whose address is 3600 Commerce Drive, Suite 601, Baltimore, Maryland 21227, and Amidus Resiliency, LLC (“Customer”), whose address is 1380 Monroe St, NW Suite 723 Washington, DC 20010 (the “Customer Address”), acting as agent. Installations will occur at 5101 Wisconsin Ave, NW Washington, DC 20016, 1300 19th St, NW Washington, DC 20036 and 1610 Park Rd, NW Washington, DC 20010 (the "Property")

Macro System Specifications: 5101 Wisconsin Ave, NW 80.6 kW $200,851.42 1300 19th St, NW 97.2 kW $237,271.37 1610 Park Rd, NW 62.37 kW $157,295.65 TOTAL SIZE 240.17 kW System Specifications TOTAL PRICE $595,418.44

Terms of Payment 15% - Contract Execution 10% - Due at construction permit issued by the authority having jurisdiction 25% - Due at first day installation 30% - Due at inspection approval by the authority having jurisdiction 20% - Due at “Permission to Operate and Final Approval” or equivalent permission by interconnection utility, and system is demonstrated to be operable Milestones will be invoiced per individual project as project timelines and construction schedules will differ by project.

Page 2 of 24

Timeline Lumina will commence the Included Services within 90 days after the Effective Date. Lumina will commence the installation Work within 120 days after the Effective Date. Lumina will achieve Substantial Completion no later than 120 days after commencement of the installation Work, as may be extended pursuant to this Contract.

Customer and Lumina hereby agree to enter into this Contract subject to the terms and conditions (including Exhibits) set forth below (included as part of this Contract), at the later date of Customer’s and Lumina’s signature below (the “Effective Date”).

Lumina Solar, Inc.

Customer Signature

Signature Signature

Date

Date

Page 3 of 24

Lumina Solar Installation Contract

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

1. Lumina shall perform the Work in accordance with the timeline set forth on the first page of this Contract. For avoidance of doubt, the “Work” consists in procurement of the materials and equipment necessary to achieve Substantially Completion of the “Projects”, including all Included Equipment and Materials, which Equipment and Materials shall meet the System Specifications, as well as all Included Services. The parties intend that the Work consists generally in a turn-key engineering, procurement, and construction (installation) of the Projects at the Projects’ Location on the Properties in accordance with the timeline, under the terms, and subject to the conditions, of this Contract. 2. Contract Inclusions. Without limiting other terms and conditions within this Contract:

a. The following are “Included Equipment and Materials”: i. Appropriately sized and rated SolarEdge Inverters with per-panel optimizers, as determined by Lumina in its discretion, but consistent with all relevant manufacturers’ respective specifications. ii. Appropriate Project solar monitoring device, as determined by Lumina in its discretion, but consistent with all relevant manufacturers’ respective specifications; iii. All installation components required for the Project, as determined by Lumina in its discretion, but consistent with all relevant manufacturers’ respective specifications; iv. The equipment and/or materials listed in Addendum I, if any; and

b. The following services are “Included Services”

i. Perform all required Project design Work; ii. Install the Projects at the Project Locations on the Properties, with all electrical Work supervised by a master electrician to the extent required by applicable Law; iii. Apply and pay for all permits and other governmental approvals required to complete the Work, to include all permitting services fees, as may apply directly related to the Work; iv. Manage and oversee Project scheduling and inspection services conducted by the authority having jurisdiction; v. Apply for interconnection, and facilitate interconnection, of the Projects with the applicable utility company and schedule meter replacement services, as may be required; it being understood that these services are not “permits” for purposes of Section 2biii. vi. Apply for, but not guarantee, then-available state and local rebates and/or grant monies available for the Project; it being understood that Lumina’s obligation is to exercise reasonable efforts in pursuing such rebates and/or grants; vii. Apply for, but not guarantee receipt of, solar “Renewable Energy Credits,” if applicable, in cooperation with Customer’s tax adviser;

Page 4 of 24

viii. Conduct one Project solar system training and orientation, not to exceed 8 hours, at a time and place mutually agreed by the parties, no later than 45 days after Substantial Completion; ix. Prepare and activate the Projects’ “remote monitor” and conduct one training and orientation to identified Customer personnel, to coincide with the general Project solar system training and orientation described in Section 2bviii; x. Preparation of an operations and maintenance manual instructing building maintenance personally as to routine operations and maintenance procedures and instructions; xi. The services listed in Addendum II, if any; and

The intent of the Work, and in particular the Included Equipment and Materials and Included Services is to provide the Project in a ‘turn-key” condition to the Customer, under the terms, and subject to the conditions, of this Contract.

3. Project Location Determination. Lumina will conduct both physical site surveys and electrical surveys at the Projects. When complete, Lumina and the Customer will determine where on the Properties the Projects are to be situated. When agreed, Lumina will install the Projects at the Properties in the area(s) to be marked on a diagram to be approved by Customer prior to beginning installation Work, incorporated at Exhibit A to this Contract (the “Project Location”). Notwithstanding the foregoing, Lumina represents and warrants to Customer that Lumina is generally familiar with the Properties, the general and local labor conditions, and all other matters that might reasonably be expected to affect the execution of the Work in connection with the Projects and that Lumina is not currently aware of any conditions that would prevent the Projects from being completed for the Project Price and in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement. 4. Subcontractors. Customer hereby acknowledges and agrees that Lumina may locate and procure the services of subcontractors, consultants, suppliers, laborers, materialmen or other vendors that in Lumina’s reasonable judgment may be necessary to complete Lumina’s duties and obligations pursuant to this Contract and that are qualified to perform the Work for which they are being engaged. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Contract, Lumina shall provide Customer with the names of all subcontractors prior to entering into any subcontracts in connection with the Projects. All subcontractors performing any component of the Work shall be licensed and insured, consistent with applicable Law, Prudent Industry Practices and reasonable commercial practices. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, each subcontractor shall have all licenses and registrations required to perform the Work to be performed by such subcontractor, including all licenses and registrations to perform the Work in the District of Columbia, and each subcontractor shall have any business registration certificate required to perform the Work; upon written request by Customer, Contractor shall, and shall cause each subcontractor to, provide reasonable evidence of same to Customer. Lumina shall provide Customer with prior written notice and request for Customer consent as to each Major Subcontractor that will be performing the installation activities at the Property. A request for Customer consent will include evidence of licenses, registrations and insurance and a detailed description of each

Page 5 of 24

Major Subcontractor’s scope of work. Site Owner will have five (5) business days to accept or reject each Major Subcontractor. Lumina shall cause all subcontractors to perform their work in conformity with all provisions hereof and shall cause all subcontractors to comply with the same requirements as to the personnel and employees of such subcontractors as are required for personnel and employees of Lumina No subcontractor is intended to be, or shall be deemed to be, a third-party beneficiary of this Contract. Lumina agrees that it shall be fully responsible to Customer for the acts and omissions of the subcontractors and of any persons directly or indirectly employed by them, as it is for the acts or omissions of persons directly employed by Lumina. Entry into any subcontract shall not relieve Lumina of any of its obligations to perform the Work in accordance with this Contract. 5. System Design Components. Exhibit B sets forth an initial list of module count and inverter sizing for the Project as intended to be installed at Project Location on the Property. Each party will agree to panel count after the physical site and electrical survey has been completed and thereafter engineering documents have been designed. 6. Electrical or Structural Upgrades. If either or both the authority having jurisdiction over the property or the interconnecting utility requires additional Work, then Lumina will notify Customer within five (5) days of becoming aware of such requirement. If Customer determines that it desires Lumina to perform such additional Work, then the parties shall execute and deliver a change order, modifying the Total Price and extending the timeline, as agreed. If Customer determines that it desires a person or entity other than Lumina to perform such additional Work, then Lumina, at its sole option (a) may unilaterally rescind this Contract with no liability to the Customer whatsoever, excepting that Lumina shall refund all deposits paid to Lumina reduced by any expenses actually incurred by Lumina until such date of rescission; or (b) if Customer and Lumina agree, the Total Price shall be renegotiated to reflect the true cost and timeline for the Work. 7. Final System Design and Parts Components. On or before the first day of installation work, Lumina will furnish to Customer a full itemization of equipment plans to be used at installation. This list will include module specifications and count, inverter specifications and count, racking specifications, and electrical and wire Management specifications. Upon Customer’s concurrence, such itemization shall replace Exhibit B, without further action of the parties, and the parties shall work in good faith to adjust the Total Price, and remaining payments accordingly, to reflect any changes to the itemization initially listed in Exhibit B. In the event that the cost of the Project, as presented, is higher than the Project Price specified in this Contract, Customer shall have the right, in Customer’s sole discretion, to terminate this Agreement, in which event any deposits and prepayments by Customer already made shall be refunded to Customer and neither party shall have any liability to the other party except to the extent expressly set forth in this Contract. 8. Order of Install. If the Project Location consists in more than one location on the Properties where any governmental authority requires separate permits or approvals as to each location, then, if all permits or approvals are not simultaneously received, Lumina will perform the installation Work on the Properties in order of permit received; provided, however, that Lumina will complete installation at one

Page 6 of 24

location before commencing installation on subsequent locations, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 9. Safety Standards. Lumina shall complete the installation Work in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices, including specifically OSHA/MOSHA. 10. Hazardous Substances. Lumina shall be responsible for the proper use and management of all Hazardous Substances brought or introduced onto the Properties (except for any Pre-Existing Hazardous Substance), including those brought or introduced by any subcontractor or vendor. Lumina shall, and shall cause its subcontractors and vendors, to comply with all applicable Laws, permits, and approvals, if any, relating to Hazardous Substances. 11. Title and Risk of Loss.

a. To the extent held by Lumina, title to the Work, and any Included Equipment and Materials, shall pass to the Customer upon the date payment for said items is made by the Customer. At the time title passes to the Customer, no instrument or other document shall be required to be delivered to Owner in order to evidence such title. Customer acknowledges and agrees that some Equipment may contain or embody intellectual property owned by a third party, and under this Section 11, Customer is receiving only those rights that Lumina has (by way of license or otherwise), if any, and nothing else. b. Without limiting the foregoing, Lumina shall retain care, custody and control of any Work until the date of Substantial Completion. Risk of loss of the Work shall transfer to the Customer on the date of Substantial Completion. Until such date, Lumina shall maintain insurance as to the work in progress.

12. Insurance. Lumina will carry liability insurance covering personal injury in an amount not less than $1,000,000, and insurance covering property damage caused by the work of a commercial solar installation contactor in an amount not less than $2,000,000. In addition, Lumina shall maintain: (i) workers compensation insurance and employers’ liability insurance in accordance with the laws of the District of Columbia; (ii) products and completed operations in the amount of $1,000,000; (iii) umbrella excess liability with an aggregate limit of $3,000,000; and (iv) automotive liability insurance covering owned, non-owned and hired automobiles in the minimum limits of (a) bodily injury - $1,000,000 each person and (ii) property damage - $1,000,000 each occurrence. All insurance policies procured under this Section 12 shall be endorsed to include a waiver of subrogation against Customer, the owners of the Property, and holder of a mortgages to the Property and shall be endorsed to indicate that the same shall not be cancelled, materially changed or amended to reduce coverage without giving Customer not less than thirty (30) days prior notice. Customer, the owners of title to the Property, and the holders of any mortgages as to the Property (together with each of their respective employees, agents, officers and directors) shall be named as additional insureds with respect to Lumina’s activities under this Contract under the coverages required by this Section 12, except for Workers Compensation policies. Contractor shall throughout the term of this Contract post certificates and/or memoranda of insurance evidencing the coverages specified in this Section 12 by providing hardcopy certificates to

Page 7 of 24

Customer. For the sake of clarity, all subcontractors working on the Project shall be required to maintain insurance meeting the same specifications set forth in this Section 12. 13. Customer Obligations.

a. Customer shall disclose to Lumina, in writing, no later than 10 days after the Effective Date, all known conditions, and conditions not known but reasonably suspected by Customer, on the Property and anticipated Project Locations. Customer’s obligation to disclose includes disclosures with respect to Hazardous Substances. b. Customer shall pay, as full and complete payment for the Work, the “Total Price”, in the amounts as and when due under “Terms of Payments,” as identified on the first page of this Contract, as modified hereunder. Lumina shall submit invoices to Customer for amounts then due and owing, and Customer shall pay all such amounts no later than 21 days after delivery of such invoices, except to the extent Customer in good faith disputes that any portion of the items stated in the invoice are due and payable, in which event Customer shall pay the portion of the invoice that is not disputed. c. Customer shall pay, as and when required by Lumina, any amounts due and owing for warranty Work as required under this Contract. d. Customer shall be responsible to pay all Taxes incurred in connection with the performance of the Work and with respect to the Project. The “Total Price” excludes such amounts. For avoidance of doubt, Lumina shall pay all employment and related, income, withholding, corporation, and other similar Taxes assessed to Lumina, but Lumina shall not be responsible for Taxes assessed of the Customer by virtue of the Projects or the Properties, including Taxes on electricity generated and sold (via net metering or otherwise) to third parties, property Taxes, or other Taxes, fees, and assessments arising by virtue of Lumina’s Work. e. Customer shall remove floor coverings, and any other obstacles or hazards, as determined and identified by Lumina, that impede or impair Lumina’s performance of the Work. If Customer and Lumina agree that Lumina shall perform any such removal or replacement, then any change order shall expressly state that Lumina is not responsible for replacement of or damage to any such items. f. Customer shall reasonably and timely assist Lumina in performance of the Work (e.g., assist with permit applications, interconnection efforts, access to the Property, etc.).

14. Other Customer Obligations. Customer agrees to: (a) notify Lumina immediately upon discovery of an emergency condition relating to the System, damage to the System, or theft of the System; (b) notify Lumina before expiration of the warranty period identified in Section 19.a within a reasonable time period if Customer discovers that any component of the Systems are not producing electricity or otherwise appears not to be functioning as intended; (c) only have the System repaired

Page 8 of 24

pursuant to the Limited Warranty described in Section 19; (d) not do anything, permit or allow to exist any condition or circumstance at the Property which would cause the System not to operate as intended; and (e) permit Lumina, after providing reasonable notice, to inspect the System for proper operation, and to make any necessary repairs. In the event that Customer fails to comply with the provisions of this paragraph, Lumina’s warranties are voided. 15. Submittals. If any design Work requires delivery of any submittal to the Customer, then the Customer shall make reasonable efforts to review such submittal and provide comments (or approvals) to Lumina within a reasonable time, not to exceed five (5) business days after delivery by Lumina provided that the notice by Lumina indicates that the proposal would be deemed approved if no objection is made to Lumina within five (5) business days. If Customer has not responded within such five (5) business day period, then every day of delay shall be deemed a delay by Customer and shall extend, day by day, the period for completion of the Project under this Contract . Lumina shall undertake to rectify the design materials and documents and resubmit for the Customer’s review, comment and approval, as appropriate (determined by Lumina in its discretion), giving due consideration to such comments and making reasonable changes or corrections as may be required or requested by the Customer; provided, however, that Lumina shall be under no obligation to accommodate any comment, request or requirement that is not consistent with applicable standards, good industry practices, or applicable Law. 16. Past Due Payment Policy. Unless otherwise agreed to in writing by Lumina, Customer understands that payment in full is due at each milestone listed on the first page of this Contract. Late payments shall accrue at the lower of (a) one percent (2%) per month and (b) the maximum rate of interest allowed under Law. In the event the account is turned over to an attorney for collection, Customer shall pay interest charges on the amount that then remains unpaid under this Contract. If any legal action or other proceedings is brought for a breach of this Contract, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys’ fees and other costs incurred in bringing such action or proceeding, in addition to any other relief to which such party may be entitled. There is a $50.00 return check charge. 17. Testing; Substantial Completion; Punch List. Lumina shall perform, or cause to be performed, all tests, approvals and inspections of the Project required by any permitting authority or otherwise as is necessary, appropriate or customary to assure proper performance and operation of the Projects and achievement of Substantial Completion. Lumina shall notify the Customer of the anticipated dates of such tests, approvals, and inspections, and Customer shall have the right at Customer’s sole cost and expense to have one or more representatives, including independent electrical engineers, present for such testing. Lumina shall notify the Customer when the Project has achieved Substantial Completion. Lumina shall provide the Customer the Punch List and any other information deemed reasonably necessary by Lumina to demonstrate achievement of Substantial Completion. Promptly following the date of Substantial Completion, Lumina shall commence and complete those portion of the Work on the Punch List so as to achieve the Operational Date.

Page 9 of 24

18. Change Orders. Any and all changes to the Work shall be agreed upon bilaterally via addendum or amendment to this Contract. The occurrence of any event or occurrence under this Section 18 shall be a basis for a change to the Work for which the Customer is responsible to adjust the costs and or timeline for completion of the Work. Any cost relief to which Lumina is entitled shall be net of insurance proceeds actually received, to be accounted in arrears.

a. Site Conditions/Preparations. i. If after the Work has commenced, Lumina discovers any subsurface, latent or otherwise unanticipated site conditions at or near the Properties that will impair, prevent, or increase the cost or timeline to perform the Work or otherwise to complete the Project, then (A) Lumina may, within ten (10) business days of such discovery, unilaterally rescind this Contract with no liability to the Customer whatsoever, excepting that Lumina shall refund all deposits paid to Lumina reduced by any then-non-refundable third-party expenses actually incurred by Lumina until such date of rescission; or (B) if Customer and Lumina agree, the Total Price shall be renegotiated to reflect the true cost and timeline for the Work. If Lumina has the right to rescind the Contract pursuant to this Section 18ai and fails to do so within ten (10) business days, Lumina shall be deemed to have waived the right to rescind this Contract under this Section 18ai. ii. If after Customer discloses all known or suspected conditions under Section 13.a, and such disclosures differ materially from those used or reasonably assumed by Lumina in preparation of the Total Price, then the parties shall work in good faith to revise the Total Price to account for such conditions. If the parties are unable to agree on such revised Total Price, then (A) Lumina may, within ten (10) business days of such disclosure by Customer, unilaterally rescind this Contract with no liability to the Customer whatsoever, excepting that Lumina shall refund all deposits paid to Lumina reduced by any then non- refundable third-party expenses actually incurred by Lumina until such date of rescission. iii. For avoidance of doubt, (i) “site conditions” include both conditions of the Property and of any structures on or near the Property, and (ii) “site conditions” excludes Pre- Existing Hazardous Substances. If Lumina has the right to rescind the Contract pursuant to this Section 18aiii and fails to do so within ten (10) business days, Lumina shall be deemed to have waived the right to rescind this Contract under this Section 18aiii.

b. Force Majeure. Lumina shall be entitled, and not be deemed in default of this Contract, to cost and or timeline relief for any delay or failure in the performance under this Contract if the delay or failure is due to any Force Majeure. In the event that Lumina intends to assert that an event of Force Majeure has occurred, Lumina shall notify Customer of the onset of such event of Force Majeure within ten (10) business days of the onset of such Event of Force Majeure, describing the Force Majeure and reasonable alternative measures that Lumina has taken and proposes to take in order to avoid the effect of such Force Majeure on Lumina’s ability to fulfill its obligations under this Contract and to mitigate the consequences thereof, and the nature and expected duration of such Force Majeure. In the event that Lumina fails to notify Customer of the occurrence of a Force Majeure event within ten (10) business days after learning of such Force Majeure event, Lumina shall be barred from invoking such Force Majeure

Page 10 of 24

as the reason for Lumina’s failure to perform. Upon the occurrence and during the continuance of any Force Majeure, the Parties shall endeavor to continue to perform their obligations under this Contract so far as reasonably practicable, and Lumina shall during the period of such circumstances protect and secure the Work in such manner as the Customer may reasonably require. c. Pre-Existing Hazardous Substances. If after the Work has commenced, Lumina encounters any Pre-Existing Hazardous Substances, regardless as to whether disclosed by Customer under Section 13.a, at or near the Properties that will impair, prevent, or increase the cost or timeline to perform the Work or otherwise to complete the Project, then (a) Lumina may, within ten (10) business days of such disclosure by Customer, unilaterally rescind this Contract with no liability to the Customer whatsoever, excepting that Lumina shall refund all deposits paid to Lumina reduced by any then non-refundable third-party expenses actually incurred by Lumina until such date of rescission; or (b) if Customer and Lumina agree, the Contract Price may be renegotiated to reflect the true cost and timeline for the Work; provided, however, that if the parties agree that Lumina shall continue with the Work, (i) as between Lumina and the Customer, the Customer shall be deemed the “generator” for purposes of applicable Law, (ii) the Customer shall bear all costs and expenses, and shall be solely liable for any response, removal, investigation, cleanup, or other remedial action required by applicable Laws with respect to any Pre-Existing Hazardous Substance, and (iii) to the fullest extent permitted by applicable Law, the Customer shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Lumina and its affiliates, and Lumina’s agents, subcontractors, and vendors (and each of their respective affiliates) from and against any and all losses, arising out of, or resulting from, or occasioned by or in connection with a Pre-Existing Hazardous Substance or any Hazardous Substance introduced, released, or spilled in, to, under, or from the Properties after Lumina commences the Work by any party other than Lumina or its subcontractors and vendors performing the Work, except to the extent such losses result from, or have been increased by, the deliberate, reckless, or grossly negligent disruption, release or exacerbation of any Pre-Existing Hazardous Substance or the rendering of the removal or remediation of Pre-Existing Hazardous Material more costly, by or on behalf of Lumina. If Lumina has the right to rescind the Contract pursuant to this Section 18c and fails to do so within ten (10) business days, Lumina shall be deemed to have waived the right to rescind this Contract under this Section 18c.

d. Project Schedule and Weather delays. Lumina will make a daily decision on whether weather or other conditions are suitable for performance of the Work. Lumina will give the Customer reasonable notice of any decision to delay the Work. Any such decision to delay shall serve to add a commensurate number of days to Lumina’s commitments in the timeline listed on the first page of this Contract.

19. Warranties:

Page 11 of 24

a. 5 Year Lumina Solar Limited Warranty on Parts (other than under Sections 19b and 19c) and Labor on Installation, measured from the date of Substantial Completion. Lumina’s warranty under this Section 19a is as follows:

i. Lumina warrants that (i) all installation hardware, brackets and supports, and all other parts and equipment (other than those identified under Sections 19b and 19c) that are furnished by Lumina as part of the Work performed under this Contract shall be free from defects in workmanship and materials suitable for Customer’s use as commercial solar electricity-generating facility for no less than 5 years, subject to normal wear and tear and maintenance and operation requirements and obsolescence that may result from advance in technology or other changes in needs or uses, under the climatic and normal operating conditions at the Properties, and otherwise in compliance with the standards of performance set forth in this Contract; (ii) all aspects of the Work (A) shall be performed in a good and workmanlike manner according to industry standards, applicable Laws and required permitting and utility standards and regulations, and (B) conform to and be designed and installed in accordance with and conformance to the System Specifications. ii. As part of this warranty, Lumina will service any materials manufacturer’s warranty for the duration of Lumina’s aforementioned 5-year warranty period. iii. Also as part of this warranty, and only if the Project Locations are wholly or partially on Customer’s roof, Lumina will repair any damage to Customer’s roof caused specifically by a roofing penetration made by Lumina in performing the Work; provided, however, that Customer shall specifically notify Lumina of any such damage within a reasonable period of time after Customer has knowledge of such damage (not to exceed 4 months after Substantial Completion) or this particular warranty is hereby void. iv. The warranty does not, however, guarantee that the completed Project shall perform as explicitly described or implied in this Contract. Lumina shall have no obligation to perform under this warranty until Customer has made full payment for the Work. The maximum period of Lumina’s warranty shall be from Substantial Completion until expiration of 5 years thereafter, and late full payment shall not serve to extend Lumina’s warranty beyond such 5-year period. By way of example, if the Customer makes full payment 1 year following Substantial Completion, (a) Lumina shall have no obligation to perform any warranty services prior to such date, and (b) Lumina’s warranty shall effectively exist for nine years.

Lumina’s warranty under this Section 19a excludes (1) any remedy for damage or defect caused by abuse, modifications not executed by or on behalf of Lumina or any of its subcontractors, improper or insufficient maintenance, improper operation, or normal wear and tear under normal usage, (2) any remedy for damages or defect in the quality or workmanship of any materials or equipment furnished by Customer or any other third party other than a subcontractor or sub-subcontractor of Lumina or any vendor for Lumina or any subcontractor or sub-subcontractor, (3) power outages or damages to the Project or to the Property arising out of or relating to power outages; (4) damages arising out of or relating to any event of Force Majeure; and (5) damages in the nature of normal wear and tear to the Project or to the roof or other site of the Project, sub-structure, siding, plumbing or electrical work not

Page 12 of 24

related to the Project.

b. 25 Year Limited Manufacturer’s Warranty on [Solar Module Performance] (documentation for which to be provided by Lumina to Customer upon Customer’s request); and c. 12 Year Limited Manufacturer’s Warranty on [Inverters & DC Optimizers] (documentation for which to be provided by Lumina to Customer upon Customer’s request). d. Lumina’s warranty under Sections 19b and 19c are only to the extent, and subject to the terms and conditions within, such manufacturers’ respective limited warranties, and the Customer acknowledges that Lumina’s warranty under Section 19a does not, and shall not be construed, to supplement or be in lieu of such manufacturers’ limited warranties. e. Remedies.

i. Customer’s sole remedy under this Section 19 is to require, by notice received by Lumina on or before expiration of the warranty period described in Section 19a, and at no cost to the Customer (except as stated below), that Lumina repair or replace, or cause to be repaired or replaced, that portion or portions of the Work pursuant to this Warranty so as to restore the Project to the condition as installed by or on behalf of Lumina. ii. If in responding to any timely warranty notice, Lumina discovers that the issue is not covered by any of the warranties under this Section 19 (such as by reason of shade and alterations other than by Lumina), Lumina shall so notify Customer of such fact and the reason such item is not covered and, before effecting any repairs, and await instructions from Customer. In the event Lumina has informed Customer that the matter is not covered by warranty and Customer elects to cause Lumina to effect repairs, then to the extent a remedy is available (e.g., repair to Project, but not removal of shade), Customer will pay for any materials, equipment or other components or parts, and Lumina reserves the right to charge Customer a service charge of $100 per hour with the minimum service charge equal to $200. iii. Until expiration of the warranty period described in Section 19a, Lumina shall be responsible for enforcing the warranties of all manufacturers and subcontractors, if any. At and after expiration of such period, the Customer shall be responsible for enforcing any warranties (including those under Sections 19b and 19c).

f. To the maximum extent permitted by applicable Law, the foregoing warranties reflect Lumina’s and the Customer’s agreement with respect to the Project, and (i) Lumina hereby disclaims, and (ii) the Customer hereby waives any other warranty or remedy, express or implied under applicable Law, including warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or otherwise as relates to recourse to Lumina at Law or in equity. Nothing in this Section 19f waives any remedy at Law or in equity as relates to any manufacturer of equipment or parts that are part of the Work.

Page 13 of 24

20. Indemnification. To the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, Lumina shall assume liability for, and indemnify, defend and hold harmless Customer, the owners of fee simple title to the Property, and the holder of any mortgage as to the Property, and any of their respective officers, employees, directors, members, shareholder, agents, or owners (the “Customer Indemnitees”) from and against Losses arising from any claim for or arising out of any injury to, or death of, any person or loss or damage to property of any person, in each case to the extent that such Losses arise from the negligence, recklessness, or willful actions of Lumina or any of Lumina’s subcontractors, sub- subcontractors, and vendors, and any of their respective officers, employees, directors, members, shareholder, agents, or owners (the “Lumina Parties”). To the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, Customer shall assume liability for, and indemnify, defend and hold harmless Lumina and its officers, employees, directors, members, shareholder, agents, or owners (the “Lumina Indemnitees”) from and against Losses arising from any claim for or arising out of any injury to, or death of, any person or loss or damage to property of any person, in each case to the extent that such Losses arise from the negligence, recklessness, or willful actions of Customer or any of Customer’s officers’ employees, agents, or contractors. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event shall the indemnification required under this Section 10 to the extent such Loss was caused by the negligence, fraud, or willful or intentional misconduct of the indemnified party or to the extent indemnification is prohibited under applicable law. 21. Limitation of Liability. Lumina assumes no liability for damage to: improperly installed, improperly maintained, defective, old, or deteriorated roof coverings or supports; siding; exterior covering or paint; underground pipes; sewer or drain lines; tanks; or any other non-visible installations. Lumina’s liability shall be limited to the Project Location. Lumina shall not be liable for damage to deteriorated or improperly installed sub-roof or roofing within the serviced area. IN NO EVENT SHALL LUMINA BE LIABLE FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY, SPECIAL OR INDIRECT DAMAGES OR LOSSES RELATING TO THIS CONTRACT. TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, LUMINA’S TOTAL LIABILITY FOR BREACH OF THIS CONTRACT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE SOLAR SYSTEM NET COST LISTED ON THE FIRST PAGE OF THIS CONTRACT. NOTHING IN THIS SECTION 21 SHALL LIMIT LUMINA’S OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 20 OF THIS CONTRACT OR OTHERWISE IN CONNECTION WITH ANY DAMAGE TO PROPERTY RESULTING FROM THE negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct of Lumina or any of its subcontractors or any of their respective agents, employees, or contractors. 22. Waiver. a. Each of the parties hereby irrevocably (i) consents and agrees that any legal action or proceedings brought in connection with this Contract shall be brought in the courts of the District of Columbia, (ii) agrees to be bound by any final judgment (after any appeal) of such court, and

Each of the Parties knowingly, voluntarily, and intentionally waives, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, any right it may have to a trial by jury in respect of any legal action or proceedings brought in connection with this Contract. This Contract and all matters arising hereunder or in connection herewith shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the Laws of the District of Columbia.

24. Survival. All provisions of this Contract that by their nature survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Contract in order to give full force and effect to the intent of the parties (including specifically, the warranties, indemnities, Hazardous Substances, and jurisdictional agreements hereunder) shall remain in effect and be enforceable to maximum extent permitted by applicable Law. 25. Severability. If any provision of this Contract is held to be illegal, invalid, or unenforceable under present or future applicable Law, such provision shall be fully severable; this Contract shall be construed and enforced as if such illegal, invalid or unenforceable provision had never comprised a part of this Contract; and the remaining provisions of this Contract shall remain in full force and effect and shall not be affected by the illegal, invalid, or unenforceable provision or by its severance from this Contract. Furthermore, in lieu of such illegal, invalid or unenforceable provision, there shall be added as part of this Contract a provision as similar in its terms to such illegal, invalid or unenforceable provision, as may be possible and be legal, valid and enforceable. 27. Good Faith Dealings; Further Assurances. The parties undertake to act fairly and in good faith in relation to the performance and implementation of this Contract and to take such other reasonable measures as may be necessary for the realization of its purposes and objectives. The parties each agree to take such actions as may be reasonably necessary or reasonably requested by the other

party that are not inconsistent with, and that do not involve the assumptions of obligations other than those provided for in, this Contract, in order to give full effect to, and to carry out the intent of, this Contract. 28. Except as provided herein where an exclusive remedy is expressly provided, the duties and obligations imposed by this Contract and the rights and remedies available hereunder will be in addition to and not in limitation of any duties, obligations, rights and remedies otherwise imposed or available at Law or in equity to the Parties. 29. Entire Agreement. This Contract cannot be modified or discharged orally unless consent in writing is made by Lumina and Customer (the “Parties”), and this Contract shall be binding upon the heirs, successors, and assigns of the Parties. This Contract supersedes all agreements previously made between the Parties. There are no other understandings or agreements. Commissioning means physical inspection of workmanship, connections, and equipment; Isc, Voc, Imp, and Vmp measurements to confirm wiring source circuit performance; ground fault testing; Inverter testing and parameter adjustments; monitoring system testing; Utility Inspection Coordination and Works Approval; and, local AHJ (code) Inspection Coordination and Works Approval.

Force Majeure means any cause that is unforeseeable and beyond Lumina’s reasonable control and not attributable to such Lumina’s negligence and has an impact that actually, demonstrably and adversely affects Lumina’s ability to perform its obligations to a material extent in accordance with the terms of this Contract. “Force Majeure” includes, but is not limited to delays or costs (or both) caused by, arising out of or relating to:

a. acts or omissions of the Customer or any person or entity for which the Customer is responsible that are not the result of the Customer exercising rights in accordance with this Contract (as to conditions that affect Lumina); b. acts or omissions of any third parties (other than those persons or entities for which Lumina is directly and either legally or contractually responsible) that are not the result of the Customer exercising rights in accordance with this Contract (as to conditions that affect Lumina); c. acts of God such as storms, fires, floods, lightning, earthquakes, hurricanes, tornadoes, mudslides, explosions, natural disasters, extreme high winds, unusually severe or unanticipated rain or other inclement weather, d. terrorism, war (whether or not declared), riot, acts of a public enemy, other civil disturbance, public disorder, blockades, insurrections, embargoes, expropriation or confiscation, epidemic or quarantine, or vandalism; e. strikes, walkouts, lockouts, or other significant labor dispute; f. discovery of endangered species, protected plants or animals, or paleontological or archeological materials at or near the Property; and

g. Hazardous Substance means (a) any substance, waste, or material that is listed, defined, designated or classified under any Law as a (i) hazardous, toxic, radioactive, or dangerous material, substance, constituent or waste, (ii) pollutant, (iii) contaminant, (iv) chemical substance, (v) solid waste, or (vi) special waste; (b) any material, substance, constituent or waste regulated under any Law; (c) petroleum, petroleum products, mold, methyl-tertiary butyl ether, lead-based paints, urea-formaldehyde foam insulation radioactive matters, polychlorinated biphenyl, pesticides, asbestos, or asbestos-containing materials; or (d) any material, substance, or waste which poses a hazard to human health, safety, natural resources, or the environment. Punch List means a list of any minor items of Work that Lumina and the Customer agree remain to be performed or corrected after the occurrence of Substantial Completion but prior to the Operational Date, which will not, individually or in the aggregate, affect the safe, continuous and reliable operation of the Project or the Work, as the case may be, in the normal course of business in accordance with prudent industry practices and in compliance with all Applicable Laws. Pre-Existing Hazardous Substances means any Hazardous Substance existing at or near the Property as of the Effective Date. Prudent Industry Practice means those practices, methods, techniques, and standards in effect in the solar power construction industry at the time of performance of the Work that are commonly used in prudent engineering and construction to design and construct equipment of similar size and type as the Project, which practices, methods, techniques and standards, in the exercise of responsible professional judgment in light of the facts known at the time a decision is made, could reasonably have been expected to accomplish the desired result consistent with good business practices, cost, reliability and safety. Prudent Industry Practice is not intended to mean the optimum practice, method, technique or standard but rather refers to a range of commonly used and reasonable practices, methods, techniques and standards. Punch List means a list of any minor items of Work that Lumina identifies as Work to be performed or corrected after the occurrence of Substantial Completion but prior to the Operational Date, which will not, individually or in the aggregate, affect the safe, continuous and reliable operation of the Project in the normal course of business. Contractor has provided conditional mechanic’s lien waivers in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to Customer; and

g. all documents that are to be delivered to the Customer by Lumina, if any, have been delivered.

Addendum III 1. The systems shall be designed for an expected lifetime of 20 years. All system components shall

have appropriate finish to limit the effects of corrosion consistent with this expected lifetime. All such components shall be new unless otherwise Customer has been presented in advance with information as to the used or refurnished items proposed to be used and Customer has approved such use in advance in writing.

2. The systems shall be designed to withstand the wind loads, snow loads, seismic loads, temperature, humidity extremes which would normally be expected to occur at the specified sites during the Systems’ design lifetime.

3. The systems’ designs shall comply with the requirements of the applicable local building codes as defined by the authority having jurisdiction over the site where the Work is to be performed.

4. The systems’ nominal power rating will be the specified nameplate power rating of the PV modules times the number of modules in the system at the time of commissioning of the system.

5. PV modules shall be listed by Underwriter's Laboratories for compliance with UL1703. Modules shall comply with the requirements of IEC 1215.

6. The inverter(s) shall be listed by Underwriter's Laboratories for compliance with UL1741.

7. Inverters shall comply with the requirements of IEEE 929.

8. All field installed wiring shall comply with the requirements of the US National Electric Code and, to the extent different, local building codes.

9. Notwithstanding the foregoing, detailed specifications for the Project are set forth in the Project Installation Authorization.

parts:
In the contract, interconnection efforts are mentioned, and it states that the customer shall reasonably and timely assist Lumina in performance of the work, which includes interconnection efforts. Here are the relevant sections:

- **Customer Obligations**:
  - "Customer shall reasonably and timely assist Lumina in performance of the Work (e.g., assist with permit applications, interconnection efforts, access to the Property, etc.)" .

- **Included Services**:
  - "Apply for interconnection, and facilitate interconnection, of the Projects with the applicable utility company and schedule meter replacement services, as may be required" .

While these sections specify that the customer needs to assist with interconnection efforts, there is no explicit mention that minor changes to interconnection do not require customer approval. However, general minor changes that fall within the industry standards, good practices, and legal compliance may not require explicit customer approval if the customer does not object within the specified timeframe as indicated in the general conditions of the contract.
